Posts.HTML:
This has probably been asked before but...
Is there a way to use supscripted variables for example string variable called "spell"
spell(1-10)=""

Posts.EditableText:
See [url=http://www.axeuk.com/quest/developer/documentation/variables-arrays.htm:tl6dcryv]Using Arrays[/url:tl6dcryv] in the [url=http://www.axeuk.com/quest/developer/documentation/asl.htm:tl6dcryv]ASL Reference[/url:tl6dcryv] of the [url=http://www.axeuk.com/quest/developer/index.htm:tl6dcryv]Quest Documentation[/url:tl6dcryv].

Although ASL variables are only afforded 1 dimension, you can create multi-dimensional arrays using properties.
Posts.HTML:
See Using Arrays in the ASL Reference of the Quest Documentation.

Although ASL variables are only afforded 1 dimension, you can create multi-dimensional arrays using properties.

Posts.EditableText: I will look it up. Thank you =)
Posts.HTML: I will look it up. Thank you =)

Posts.EditableText:
Got it. I was trying () instead of [] and I was putting %% around my numerics. I kept trying to search for subscripted variables instead of arrays. This will save me a whole lot of "case" work lol.
Thanks again.
Wonderjudge.
